fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Epic Name* field and *Epic Status* field is not appearing in the new _Jira Issue View_ even though they are part of the screen.

They also do not appear in *Issue Layout* to be configured as primary or secondary fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Epic Name* and *Epic Status* field to the screen of the project.
# In *Issue Layout*, they don't appear there.
# They don't appear in new _Jira Issue View_ too.

h3. Expected Results
* *Epic Name* and *Epic Status* should show up in *Issue Layout* and in new _Jira Issue View_.

h3. Actual Results
* *Epic Name* and *Epic Status* do not show up in *Issue Layout* and in new _Jira Issue View_.

h3. Workaround
* Disable new _Jira Issue View_ to view these 2 fields.
fields.summary: Epic Name and Epic Status field not appearing in new Jira Issue View

fields.description:
Hi Team,

This is a feature request for Confluence macro- Roadmap planner.
1. We want to fetch the data from JIRA into the bars (please see the attached screenshot).
2. We have a use case - Whenever anyone is working on a website a bar should be made of that request with its due date, created date on it. Can this be done automatically?

Regards
Priyanka
fields.summary: This is a feature request for Confluence macro- Roadmap pl

fields.description:
Story comments show date wrong, instead of 13:06 it shows k:06

!image-2019-04-25-12-24-06-641.png!

Hovering the mouse reveals the time as 13:06
fields.summary: Story comments show date wrong

fields.description:
I created a freshly new trial site on atlassian.net yesterday to evaluate the software for my new company. Everytime I want to access the site, it says "Something went wrong" after redirecting me 3 times. The error happened even after deleting cookies and all the stuff that has been mentioned on the regarding support page.

I attached a picture of the error message below:

!image-2019-04-25-09-39-06-600.png!

 

PS: Sorry if this is the wrong place to connect with you regarding this bug.
fields.summary: Can't open my newly created test-site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to eliminate non-working days, such as weekends or holidays in next-gen projects. This is something you can do in classic projects by configuring the board -> Working days and selecting which days of the week your team typically works.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to configure working days in a next-gen project
fields.summary: As a next-gen administrator, I want to be able to define working days to the project

fields.description: Please build releases into Next Gen. we cannot migrate without them :(
fields.summary: Next Gen Releases

fields.description: Enable separate backlog tab for Kanban
fields.summary: Next Gen - Kanban Backlog

fields.description: Ability to use a JQL filter to create a board view of multiple projects
fields.summary: Team-managed (formerly next-gen) - Create Board based on Filter

fields.description:
h3. Description
Using the Kanban mode with Backlog display all the issues that are at the board in the backlog view.

This is very different from the behavior of the Kanban board from the Classic Project which the backlog displays the backlog section and only the issues from the first board column status.

h3. Expected
At the backlog view, display only issues that are in Backlog and only the issues that were prioritized and from the first status.
At the board, display the issues that were moved from backlog to the board (first status) and issues that are in any other status.

h3. Actual results
At the Next-Gen it displays all the issues from the board at the backlog view.
fields.summary: Using the Kanban mode with Backlog display all the issues that are at the board in the backlog view

fields.description:
Hello,

We need to be able to view fields (such as people and number) on the roadmap view for quarterly planning. We like a list view of all of our epics with fields such as Reporter, Assignee, etc. and number value such as RICE score. We use this to be able to have a birds eye view when planning and prioritizing. 

 

This exists on classic projects in the ability to add fields to the card layout in backlog.

Is this something you'd consider adding?

Thank you,
fields.summary: Next Gen - Fields on Roadmap View

fields.description: Hi, with the new next-gen project, I understand you are working on adding subtasks, but I was hoping you also can add a feature to drag-n-drop the tasks into a story and automatically that converts to a sub-tasks within that story. and if a sub-tasks is part of another story and if we can drag-n-drop that into another story, that will also be great.
fields.summary: Tasks/Subtasks drap-n-drop in-to stories

fields.description:
Hi can you please change the project lead for my following projects to Tracy Collier
 * Chapters
 * Strategy
 * QLD Disaster
 * Prison FCA
 * CUA FV
 * Prison NAB
fields.summary: Next Gen projects - assigning a lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are issues appearing in the Sprint Report as "Removed from Sprint", which are completed, and have *not* been removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create some issues
# Create a sprint and add the issues to this sprint
# Create a Fix Version
# Add the issues to this Fix Version
# Start the Sprint
# Move all issues to Done (with resolution)
# Complete the Sprint
# Go to the Release page and release the version
# Go to the Sprint Report
** You'll notice that the issues that were from the release are showing under Issues Not Completed panel

h3. Expected Results

The Sprint Report should not be affected by releasing a version

h3. Actual Results

The issues appear in the "Issues Not Completed" section of the report.

h3. Workaround

# There is no workaround as it is not possible to add a completed sprint into the Sprint field, unless re-opening the Sprint that will affect other reports.
fields.summary: Issues that are completed are showing up as "Issues Not Completed" on the Sprint Report

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The new JIRA view for JIRA issue details panel no longer show the estimation statistics field by default. This field used to be shown by default on the side panel regardless if the said field is in the screen or not.

Estimation Statistics field

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

In old JIRA issue detail view, it shows even if not put into the issue view screen.

 !Untitled.png|thumbnail! 

For convenience of the user, it is better to show the field. This will allow easier estimation edits. Currently you have to add the estimation field and then arrange it in screen layout to get the field to show again. It's quite a hassle with the current implementation.
fields.summary: The issue detail panel in the new JIRA issue view should show the estimation statistics field regardless of screen/field configuration

fields.description: need to be able to plan sprints with a multifunctional team and group stories by components within the sprints. Having an easy way to group and filter by component would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Ability  to plan sprints by component much like I do for epics, so that the sprints are better managed for a multifunctional team

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to use Sprint Health Gadget and have the information about scope changed.

Currently, if we change the scope of the sprint from a Next-Gen project, we receive a notification that the scope will be changed but this information is not displayed at the reports either in Sprint Health Gadget.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to use Sprint Health Gadget and have the information about scope changed

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When adding a team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project via Filters to the company-managed (formerly classic) Board, the Epics of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project still shows as unlabelled issuekey on the Epic Pane of the company-managed (formerly classic) Board.
{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project
 - Create some Issues using the Epic Issuetype
 - Create a filter that comprises of issues from a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project and a company-managed (formerly classic) project.
 - Navigate to Manage Boards and Create a new Scrum Board using the filters you just created.
 - Go the newly created backlog and Click on the "Epic" pane and see the "unlabelled Issue-key of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.{panel}
h3. *Expected Results*

The Epics of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project should actually link to its child issues.
h3. *Actual Results*

The Epics of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project shows unlabelled issuekey on the Epic Pane on the company-managed (formerly classic) Backlog.
 !epic.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Notes*

* Epic from team-managed (formerly next-gen)n will be shown in Backlog of Scrum board (company-managed (formerly classic)); as if it's "standard" issue type.
* Epic's children won't be shown in Backlog of Scrum board (company-managed (formerly classic)); as if it's "Subtask". They will be shown if it's added to Active Sprint and will be shown there (Active Sprint view).
* In the backlog, child issues show a label of sub-task from the Epic instead of child issue

h3. *Workaround*

currently, there's none, as the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project is independent of other Projects.
fields.summary: Adding a team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project via Filters to the company-managed (formerly classic) Board shows the Epics of the team-managed (formerly next-gen) as unlabelled Issuekey

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the "old" issue view, when you click the "Comment" button and start typing in the comment field, the header of the issue view is hidden 

h3. Expected Results

The issue view header is hidden.

h3. Actual Results

The header of the issue view, containing the summary, the issue key, and the description is "pushed up" and it becomes hidden from the view 

Below follows the video describing how to reproduce the problem

https://cl.ly/5e6b0b967465

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

* Refresh the page
* Enable the new issue view:
# Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, enable this feature by clicking on the grey button (it will become green)
fields.summary: Clicking the "Comment" button and typing a comment in the Kanban issue detail view hides the header of the issue view

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Can you please let us know the standard procedure to clone the Jira project with everything (Like: Issue, User comments, attachments ).
fields.summary: How to Clone Project with everthing

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to import issues with parent-child(epic-task) relationship to a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.

When trying to csv import, "Parent issue ID" doesn't show up.

It will be great to have the ability to specify the parent ID when importing csv files to team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects as well.
fields.summary: Ability to import issues with parent-child(epic-task) relationship to team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Branches and pull requests are missing on development panel
h3. Environment

Jira Software + Github integration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a commit and a pull request on Github and add a issue key on them
 # Access the issue and only the commit will be displayed

h3. Expected Results

Branches and pull requests with issue references should be displayed on the development panel.
h3. Actual Results

Only commits are displayed
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

# Remove the Github organization https://<your site>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.github.integration.production/github-post-install-page
# On https://github.com/settings/installations, click on *Configure* (next to *Jira*) and then on *Uninstall*
# On https://github.com/settings/apps/authorizations, click on *Revoke* (next to *Jira*)
# Go to https://<your site>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.github.integration.production/github-post-install-page and add the integration
fields.summary: Branches and pull requests are missing on development panel

fields.description:
As a new features tester I am unable to hide the tasks that are not relevant to my work.

It is a good thing to see the status of other issues. Despite this, it would make handling "READY FOR TEST" type tasks much easier if one were able to hide the "TO DO", "IN PROGRESS", "DEVELOPMENT DONE" and "DONE", as I am focusing solely on tests. The number of issues others are working on may be a little overwhelming and distracting from the testing.

I am rather new to Jira and its inner mechanics, so please understand if this is already possible or if it had already been suggested.
fields.summary: Add the ability to hide task status columns

fields.description:
Completed Epics are still listed when you select the Epic filter in a next-gen board.

For big projects with a large number of Epics, it would be impossible to use this filter.

Please change the Epic filter to only show open/in progress Epics or create an option to hide completed Epics.
fields.summary: Next-gen board - Completed Epics are still listed on Epic filter.

fields.description:
In classic Kanban backlog, there are 2 areas: the backlog view at the bottom and the first board's column at the top.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to hide or remove the first board's column are in the board's backlog
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to hide/remove the upper area from the classic Kanban backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The issue status is not accurate on Sprint report when its status is not mapped
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-15 at 18.16.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the actual issue status on Sprint report when the status is not mapped
fields.summary: Display the actual issue status on Sprint report when the status is not mapped

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Board doesn't load all issues when using swimlanes by stories

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board that will return issues assigned to currentUser()
# Add swimlanes by stories
# Create 5 stories (keep then unassigned)
# Create 999 sub-tasks inside each story
# Assign one sub-task from each story to you user
#* The board will load
# Create a new sub-task inside one of the 5 stories create on step 3
#* The board will be empty because the sum of the swimlanes and their children is higher than 5000 issues

h3. Expected Results
The board loads all issues

h3. Actual Results
There are missing issues

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Board doesn't load all issues when using swimlanes by stories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a user, I want to be able to share a project's roadmap/project without consuming licenses.
h3. Suggested Solution

A user should be able to share a link to somebody else that provides view access to the project without having to explicitly consume a license of its instance

Also, allow users to embed the Roadmap view in external pages/websites
h3. Workaround

Customers can already export a roadmap to an image and thus share a non-interactive version of the roadmap with stakeholders. The image export is available in the roadmap's _Export_ button.
fields.summary: Ability share Roadmaps/projects without consuming a license

fields.description: Right now the column contraints only works per board. However, when you run parallel sprints, this makes the WIP limit useless because each team is interested in individual WIP limits. So I suggest to apply WIP limits to each sprint individually.
fields.summary: Column contraints per sprint when running parallel sprints

fields.description:
Some operating systems are now offering a "dark mode". Generally, it is easier on some people's eyes. Please consider an option to switch to a dark mode for the workspace on the product Web pages. 

The Dark Mode option, might be just a Boolean switch. Or it might be interesting to be able to set the background color and text color for the main workspace on the Web page. For example, currently the "side bar" background and text color can be user modified.

Example MS Visual Studio in Dark Mode:

!image-2019-04-12-12-10-09-286.png!
fields.summary: Create an optional Dark Mode for Jira & Bitbucket

fields.description:
With the new Jira issue view, the fields are all in one column in the backlog view. 

 !Backlog.png|thumbnail! 

The issuekey, summary, status and description are all locked to the top. It would be useful if the locked fields layout are configurable so that more important fields from a backlog perspective can be placed to the top.
fields.summary: Allow locked fields layout configuration in the backlog page

fields.description: Creating a task to added my tax into systems
fields.summary: Would like to include more tax type into payment screen

fields.description: Creating a task for adding new currencies into my application
fields.summary: Would like to include more currency option in payment screen

fields.description:
Hi ,

In our organization we wants to integrate ,JIRA Cloud instance with Microsoft Azure.So that the users can use the same user name and password for Jira cloud which we are using for the Outlook 365,when we login into the Outlook it needs to redirect automatically,which means there is no need of mentioning user name and password for jira cloud.

Can this be possible.If possible ,can you please provide me the complete documentation .
fields.summary: Regarding JIRA Cloud Integration with Microsoft Azure(For SSO)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Unfortunately, in light of more urgent priorities, our team is not working on this feature anymore. We know this will disappoint many of you and is not the answer many of you were looking for. We’ll let you know when we are ready to begin work on it.

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to define a default issue type in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects. The selected issue type will be the last issue type used by the user. Considering different users may use different issues types, there will not be a "default issue type" defined to all users

h3. Suggested Solution

As a team-managed (formerly next-gen) user, I want to be able to define a default issue type in the project's settings to make sure all users will have the same issue type selected.
fields.summary: As a team-managed (formerly next-gen) user, I want to be able to define a default issue type in the project's settings

fields.description:
Now when I want swimlanes based on components, a custom field or labels I need to create a JQL for every single unique value. Whenever a new value is added I need to also add this as a new JQL swimlane to the different boards.

It would really help me if we can just specify "Base swimlanes on issue property", and then specify the property.
fields.summary: Swimlanes based on a issue property without having to specify all of them separately with JQL's

fields.description:
As the next-gen projects are described as a "buisness solution", I would love to have a feature that already exists in Asana system.  In short:

 

email notification regarding my observed tasks, would have field buttons, that are redirecting to the edit view for that specific field.  example attached:

 

!image-2019-04-11-13-56-01-894.png!
fields.summary: As a Jira user, i would like to have an option to configure specific field redirects in e-mail notifications

fields.description:
Currently, on the next-gen software project, only Epic Issue types can be added to the Roadmap features as mentioned here https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/roadmap-957979308.html

However, I would like to be able to add any Issue type be it "Task", "Sub-task", "Bug" etc to the Roadmap, once linked to an Epic, so the other Issue type will be shown just the way the Epic shows.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user I would like to add any Issue types to the Roadmap

fields.description:
Next gen currently provides a sprint feature within a single project. 

It would be good to provide a centralized view for multiple sprints from different projects in one page. This is useful for cases where a single team is working on multiple sprints with the same attributes (sprint timeframe) from different projects.
fields.summary: Centralized view for multiple next-gen sprints

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,
Assignee and issue type filters have been [introduced|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Introducing-new-features-for-Jira-Software-Cloud-s-roadmap/ba-p/1250287] on your roadmap. Please give it a try and let us know what you think!
We are closing this ticket, but if you feel this issue hasn’t been fully addressed (e.g. filtering by text?), kindly tell us more about your use case (e.g. how comprehensive is your text search? What kind of text(s) are you looking for?).
Thank you,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
In the roadmap of next-gen projects, user can filter the epics only by status.
 It will be great if user could filter by assignee, or some text entered.
fields.summary: Filtering roadmap by certain texts or assignee

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attempting to click on the "Project Settings" link in the left-hand navigation of a next gen project when currently viewing the "Pages" page for that project will cause that nav item to fail to function.

h3. Environment
Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Next Gen Project.
# Browse to the "Pages" for that project.
# Attempt to browse to the "Project Settings" 

h3. Expected Results

The user is brought to the project settings pages for that project.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, and the button spinner spins forever.

h3. Workaround

Browse to the board, then browse to the project settings.
fields.summary: Clicking "project settings" from the "Pages" page of a Next Gen project does nothing

fields.description:
As a Kanban board user,

I want the option to report by story point totals or issue counts

So that I can easily see the impact to flow by the size of work items

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Each of the Kanban board reports allows selection of issue count or story point total for the y-axis values
 * Addition of frequency distribution report for Kanban board teams
 * Option to select issue count or story point total is not set at the board level (all or nothing)
 * Extra credit: dashboard gadgets support Kanban teams, rather than only Scrum teams, including selection of story point totals or counts for relevant gadgets, such as created/resolved issues
fields.summary: Kanban board option to count story points or issue count

fields.description: Be able to create customised reports based on the fields. Be able to schedule them for delivery at a certain time
fields.summary: Creation of customised reports

fields.description: Ability to colour code the cards on the board
fields.summary: Colour Code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using invalid JQL in the Kanban's sub-filter crashes the board. Although the field displays a message that the filter is invalid, it saves the invalid filter, making the board inaccessible to revert the change 

h3. Environment

JIra Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira Software classic Kanban project or board
# Access the board's setting and edit the sub-filter value using an invalid JQL query
# Click *Save*

h3. Expected Results

A message is displayed informing that the filter is invalid and the change is not saved

h3. Actual Results

A message is displayed informing that the filter is invalid but the change is saved, crashing the board.

The below exception is thrown in the log:

successful  : false,
status      : 500,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 66010083,
aborted     : undefined,
}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Version report times out when there is a high amount of issues associated

h3. Environment
Jira Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add high amount of issues to a version (eg: 5000)
# Open the Version report

h3. Expected Results
The report is loaded or a message asking to reduce the amount of associated issues is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The below message is shown on the report page:
{noformat}
This version does not contain any issues.
{noformat}

Or the page doesn't load and timeout

h3. Workaround
While the permanent fix is not released, the workaround consists on splitting the issues in different versions.
fields.summary: Version report times out when there is a high amount of issues associated

fields.description:
See screenshot below for suggestion of the feature.
Even better would also be a sum of the remaining sub-tasks estimates.
!feature.png!
fields.summary: Screen for Story subtasks list should include the hours estimate of the subtasks

fields.description:
When I copy a sharable link from GDrive, and paste into Jira task window, the link text is now different and won't allow me to save the description and text. 

I get error: The text editor failed  Retry your last action, or refresh the page.

 

Previously, the copy/paste just pasted the link address, now, a different link pastes,
fields.summary: The text editor failed Sharable link won't save

fields.description:
The left hand Jira menu on the system is not rendering for a number of our users. 

We can see a javascript error in the console highlighting that something has failed to render.

Affect UserIds include : tim@swipejobs.com, [pira@swipejobs.com|mailto:pira@swipejobs.com] and [michelle@swipejobs.com|mailto:michelle@swipejobs.com]

 
This was first noticed this morning at approx 8am 8 April. On Friday 5 April everything was working perfectly fine and no issues. 
Confluence is working and users have full access to that, it's only the Jira left hand menu:
- I am using a mac - running High Sierra version 10.13.3
- Using Chrome (Version 73.0.3683.86 (Official Build) (64-bit)
{color:#202124}- {color}I have cleared cache, restarted the computer, logged back in and hard reset the browser
- Tried logging in using Safari and same issue occurs - menu is still not accessible 
- Also do not have access to the TSD project [https://swipejobs.atlassian.net/projects/TSD/queues/custom/1]
We have tried rebooting, clearing cache, disabling VPN and turning off antivirus.
fields.summary: Left Hand Side Menu fails to load for a number of users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently there's no way to pull the working days for a board using Cloud APIs. We use this for estimate graphs as well as showing a custom spin on the days remaining. Currently we have this harded coded, but it would be nice to dynamically pull this in.

An API to get the calculated days remaining would also be great.
fields.summary: GET workingDays from Board Configuration
Extend amount of colours available for epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Once opening a specific release there's a pop up displaying the text below:
{code}Synchronisation of development data complete. Please reload.{code}

This behaviour occurs when the site is integrated with Github:
* Github: [^github_sync.mp4]
* Bitbucket: [^bitbucket_sync.mp4]

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide the pop up message like on Bitbucket integration
fields.summary: Remove the pop up informing the synchronisation of development data is complete

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a bug in the inline issue create where there are multiple custom fields with the name "Epic Link" or "Epic link" in the database. There will also be a duplicate custom field in one of the projects.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Scrum board that meets the above conditions https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=xxx&view=xxxx.xxxx&epics=visible 
 # Select an Epic from the Epic panel
 # Click on *+ Create issue* to create a new issue
 # Expect the issue to be created as part of the EPIC but instead get created with pop up 'Your issue xxxx has been created but is not currently visible."
 # Instead the issue appears at "Issues without epics" but can be moved easily to the EPIC after creation

h3. Expected Results

Issue will be created and added to the Epic
h3. Actual Results

Issue will be created but not added to the selected Epic. 
h3. Workaround

You can move the created Issue to the EPIC after creation
fields.summary: Inline issue create fails to attach to Epic when there are multiple custom fields with the name "Epic Link" or "Epic link"

fields.description:
The lozenge for the glance used to be vertically centred with the text on the left. However, now it is off-centre. These lozenges should be updated to be properly aligned again.



h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Issue glance lozenges are not aligned properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Expose a REST API to return the linked pages for a sprint.
 !Test_Scrum_Board_-_Agile_Board_-_Jira_Linked_pages.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
There's no current way to retrieve related links for a sprint. We'd like to create an app that allows easily surfacing these pages, but there's no Cloud API way to retrieve these linked pages.
fields.summary: Retrieve Linked Pages For Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

As a customer, I would like to have the ability to set up triggers on Next-Gen projects as we have on Classic ones.


h3. Solution
You can use the automation tool to create workflow triggers...
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-triggers/
https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/guides/expand-jira/automation
fields.summary: Ability to create workflow triggers on Next-Gen projects

fields.description: Now seems we can not get the project change info on audit log, so I cannot know who change someone custom field's configuration. It will be great, if you can provide a way to search change info for us.
fields.summary: I want to get the change log in jira project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In board settings, searching for a filter that contains @ in the text does not return any result even though it exists

!Created filter.png|thumbnail! 
 !Search in save filter.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter and add @ in the name . (i.e Filter for @)
 # Go to any board settings
 # Under Saved filter , search for the filter

h3. Expected Results

Should return the result for the saved filter
h3. Actual Results

Returns no match

*Application logs:*
h3. Workaround

On the board's saved filter selection(s), begin by typing "@" instead of the word "Filter for".
 !Screenshot 2019-04-04 at 4.33.34 PM.png|width=351,height=117!
fields.summary: Results for filter contains @ in the name is not returned in Board settings

fields.description:
As a user: When *creating* an issue, I want to have the ability to add the Epic link (from the  dropdown). See screenshot attached.

As an Admin - In project settings/Issue types:  I want to be able to add the Epic Link to an issue type (e.g. story, Task, Bug).

 

I searched but didn‘t find a similar task yet. If it‘s a duplicate, feel free to close.
fields.summary: Ability to add Epic when creating an issue in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the UI language to Japanese
# Access a backlog
# Select End Date from the date picker
# Click "Start(開始)"

h3. Expected Results
The sprint will start

h3. Actual Results
An error is showing saying an invalid format is entered.
Checking the network console, POST rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/<N>/start is returning 400 error
 !スクリーンショット 2019-03-04 16.03.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Change the UI to English
* Seeing the screenshot above, "AM" was entered automatically by the date picker. Changing this to "午前" manually to align with the Start Date will work.
fields.summary: Unable to start sprint in Japanese UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue detail view doesn't load
h3. Environment

* Jira Software Cloud

* Chrome / Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn off the new issue view
 # Open the *board* or the *backlog*
 # Click on an issue

h3. Expected Results

Issue detail view keeps loading
h3. Actual Results

Issue detail view doesn't load

The error below is displayed on browser console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getIssueDataByKey' of undefined
    at V (batch.js:10255)
    at G (batch.js:10255)
    at g (batch.js:10255)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js:10255)
    at j (batch.js:76)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js:77)
    at Object.fire (batch.js:77)
    at j (batch.js:76)
    at Object.add [as done] (batch.js:76)
    at Object.then (batch.js:78)
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The issue is intermittent.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Issue detail view doesn't load

fields.description:
When I'm working on an issue, I use it as a "laboratory notebook" or a "journal."  That is, I record details about what I did and what I observed.  This means that I never have to repeat an experiment if I forget what happened - it's always there in the issue for me.  This is especially important if experiments take a long time to set up and run.

This is great if you're the assigned engineer, or an engineer trying to learn from someone's previous investigation.  This is _terrible_ if you're a manager, trying to wade through your e-mail to stay up-to-date on an issue, and getting caught in a blizzard of obtuse, technical detail.

It would be a good start if JIRA had a mechanism so that one could mark a comment (as in Confluence) with "do not notify."  That way, technical detail could be captured without burying those who don't care to see it with e-mail.  It would be even better if that mark were called something like "technical detail," and optionally invisible when someone like a manger decides to view the issue history.
fields.summary: Enable "do not notify" or "technical detail" flag on issue comments.

fields.description: On the workload report, the estimate of the subtask isn't summed to the remaining estimate of the backlog. Considering that the subtasks are part of the worked need on the task, would be useful to have the estimate of the subtask considered on the workload as well.
fields.summary: Workload should consider the subtask estimate

fields.description: Based on our corporate workflows, it would be great if Next-gen allowed you to add status values the same as classic. We need to have a cancel, hold, approved among others.
fields.summary: Next-gen status values

fields.description:
Please add automatic link to Epic when story assigned to Epic. I don't see in which epic story belongs to unless I go to change Epic in local menu.

Jiri
fields.summary: show in which Epic user story belongs to in detail view

fields.description:
There is a bug in how multiple builds for the same pipeline are being displayed in the Development Panel.

See the attached sample input for three builds that are associated with the same pipeline.

The summary on the View Issue Page should show the status of the last build, which is a success, but instead it shows a failing build.

In the details view, it should show a single successful build, instead it shows three builds.
fields.summary: Build updates from same pipeline are not consolidated properly
Something has gone wrong

fields.description:
Hi team,

can you release simple Sprint report like in next-gen project. We all need simple tool where we go back to our sprint. Current 2 available reports are not serving this purpose and they are for different purpose.

Our organization can't move to next gen without this even when we would love to.

thanks

Jiri
fields.summary: Sprint report in Next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Story Points field doesn't accept decimal numbers when using different language settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the user personal settings to a language different from English -- French, Spanish, etc;
# Create an issue;
# Change the Story Points value to a decimal number.

!Screen Recording 2019-03-28 at 02.23 PM.gif! 

h3. Expected Results

The field should accept the decimal number.

h3. Actual Results

A validation failed error occurs.

h3. Workaround

The user must change the personal settings to English in order to properly update the field.
fields.summary: Story Points field doesn't accept decimal numbers when using different language settings.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful to have the ability to quickly toggle between available quick filters applied to a board via a hotkey

Currently there isn't a [keyboard shortcut|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile066/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-keyboard-shortcuts] to toggle from one quick filter to the next.

Applicable use case where this would save time is when using a quick filter that show the assignee of each member of a team working on a board, during Sprint planning sessions you may want to switch between each user's quick filter and under current behavior to do this you need to select the secondary quick filter, then Deselect the original quick filter to change context to the next users filter.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add hotkey option to select next quick filter from the Active Sprint and Backlog views of a board
fields.summary: Hotkey to toggle through quick filters

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to change the priority of an issue is by editing it, but that involves scrolling and searching to find the priority to change.

If Jira users could set the priority directly from the three dots menu (at the top-right of the issue view and board's issue detail view), it would save time provide a better user experience
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to change the priority of an issue using the three dots menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user changes the Jira language in personal settings from English to German (and some other languages), the burnup report is showing wrong value when selecting "Story point estimate" in "Estimation".
h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add multple issues into sprint and add values into "Story point estimate" fields
 # Start sprint and change values of "Story point estimate" fields as you transition issues
 # Transition issues to 'Done' status and 'Complete' sprint
 # View Reports -> Burnup Report in English language
 # Make sure that "Estimation" is set to "Story point estimate"
 # Change language in "Personal Settings" to German
 # Go back to Reports -> Burnup Report and refresh the page to view it in German

h3. Expected Results

Burnup report in English and German language should show the same value.
h3. Actual Results

Burnup report in English is showing the correct value, but the report in German is showing the same report when "Estimation" is set to "Issue Count".
*1st example:*
 View in English:
 !In English.png|thumbnail!
 View in German (Story point estimate):
 !In German.png|thumbnail!
 View in German (Issue count):
 !In German (issue count).png|thumbnail! 
*2nd example:*
 View in English:
 !In English_2.png|thumbnail! 
 View in German (Story point estimate):
 !In German_2.png|thumbnail! 
 View in German (Issue count):
 !In German (issue count)_2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

View report in English language.
fields.summary: Burnup report in next-gen project shows wrong value when selecting different language

fields.description:
I have invited a user as Jira Service Desk team member and Site Admin and when he is trying to login he gets error 500.

 

Please advise.

 

Regards,

Eleni
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk error 500

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user accesses a next-gen project without specifying the board id, the page reloads indefinitely

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a next-gen project
# Copy its URL {{https://xxxxxx.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/NG/boards/1}}
# Paste it in the browser address bar and remove the number at the end of the URL (the board Id) {{https://xxxxxx.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/NG/boards}}
# Press the "Enter" key

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to the Jira home page or to a message like "Page not found" should be displayed

h3. Actual Results

The page keeps reloading indefinitely

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Keep the board Id in the URL
fields.summary: When a user accesses a next-gen project without specifying the board id, the page reloads indefinitely
Allow special commands in Pull Request Comment, like smart commits

fields.description:
As a Jira Kanban or Scrum board user, I want the ability to collapse and expand individual workflow columns so that I can both focus on work items in one status and see the big picture, when needed.

Acceptance criteria:
 * When collapsed, a column that is hovered over with the cursor shows its status name, WIP limit, and current content count
 * All columns on a board can be toggled to expand or collapse at one time
 * Single columns can be toggled to expand or collapse one at a time
 * Collapsing a column does not interfere with the existing swim lane behavior
 * A horizontal scroll bar is added to the Kanban or Scrum board view so the entire board may be viewed when all columns are expanded
fields.summary: Able to collapse columns on Kanban and Scrum boards

fields.description:
Currently the Scrum Board columns each have a header that shows the title of the column has the issue count. I propose that this should also/optionally show the story point total in that column.

I further propose a sub-head at the top of each grouping that shows the story point total and/or issue count. That way it's easy to see progress through the board by Epic or Assignee.
fields.summary: Point totals display on Agile Board

fields.description:
Hi,

It is easy to follow logged days when you logged into issues daily. However, there is a fact that most users log issues at the end of month. When you click log work menu "time spent" and "date started" areas appear. When you click to date area to change day you just understand weekends.

My suggestion is to show a tool tip on days which has log work. Logged time can be shown on the day also.

Thanks in Advance
fields.summary: Different View for Logged Day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The commits with references to Jira issues are listed on _Development panel_. However if the commit message contains an action command then it doesn't reflect on the issue.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud + Github integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Github add-on and create an integration
 # On Github, create a commit with the message *<TICKET ID> #comment test*

h3. Expected Results
The commands on commit message are executed.

h3. Actual Results
The commit is listed on development panel but it's command is not executed.

h3. Notes
No error on logs

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Smart commits are not working with Github integration

fields.description:
Hello the community,

Thanks for taking time to help me.

I'm tying Jira Next-Gen and I don't find how to see story points for each member of my team for a sprint. The feature existed in the other version of Jira but here it's impossible to find :(

!image-2019-03-21-16-35-09-864.png!

 

 

Thanks for your answer,

Elodie
fields.summary: Next-Gen : Story points for a sprint

fields.description:
Jira send for every change on a issue immediately a email.

I.e. Someone add a label, change the Status, assign the ticket to someone else and add a comment to the issue. All these action are done within three minutes.

I receive for these change 4 mails, but I want only one Mail with all changes in it to receive for all these changes.

i.e. send a notification 5 Minutes after the last change with all changes together.

 

An other possible Solution:

Let the user configure the notification he wants to receive in the three case he is assignee of the issue and he is not the assignee of the issue or the is creator of the issue, but currently not the assignee.

In example:

I'm not the assignee then I'm only interested on these changes:
 * Status change
 * new Comment
 * Assignee change to me

I'm the assignee of the ticket, then I'm interested in all changes.

I'm the creator of the ticket, them I'm interested in these changes:
 * Status change
 * new Comment
 * Assignee change to me
 * fix Version
fields.summary: JIRA spams with notifications
Text formatting lists get confused by curly braces

fields.description:
There is a bug where by old data, provided by an addon, is being shown in the Dev Panel.

The steps to reproduce are:
 # Install the [sample addon|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/jira-data-provider-sample-addon/src]
 # Push devinfo data against an issue
 # View the pushed data in the Dev Panel (this loads the internal cache)
 # Uninstall the [sample addon|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/jira-data-provider-sample-addon/src]
 # Verify that no data is visible in the Dev Panel
 # Re-install the [sample addon|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/jira-data-provider-sample-addon/src]
 # See that the data pushed by the first install of the [sample addon|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/jira-data-provider-sample-addon/src] is still visible
 # Wait more than 30 minutes (the internal cache should expire)
 # See that the data pushed by the first install of the [sample addon|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/jira-data-provider-sample-addon/src] is still visible

The expected behaviour is that at step 4, all the pushed data will be deleted and no longer visible.
fields.summary: Old data visible after re-installing add-on

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Raising a bug that is described by [~amerlino] on her internal Confluence page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Scrum board that has 4 statuses: To Do, In Progress, Done, Closed
 # Create & start a sprint "Sprint 1" with two issues in it.
 # Transition one issue all the way to "Closed".
 # Modify the status-column mapping of the board to unmap the Closed status.
 # Create a future sprint on the backlog.
 # Complete the sprint.
 # View the issue which was transitioned to Closed.

h3. Expected Results

The issue which was Closed should only be assigned to one sprint - Sprint 1.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is assigned to Sprint 1 (the completed sprint) *and* the future sprint. This is visible on the issue view page, but *not* in the backlog, because the Closed status is not mapped to any column of the board.
h3. Workaround

Ensure that all statuses are mapped to a column before completing sprints to prevent issues being tacked onto any future sprints.
fields.summary: When completing a sprint, if an issue is assigned to that sprint, but is not displayed on the board (due to status mappings), that issue is incorrectly added to the next future sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user accesses a next-gen project which he/she does not have permission, the "This project isn't available" page never loads 

*Update*
We have verified this to happen also with Classic Jira Projects in which users don't have the "Browse Project Permissions"


h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a private next-gen project in a Jira cloud site
# Log into Jira using an account that has no access to the project in the previous step
# In the left menu, click *Project* and click in the name of the project

h3. Expected Results

The user sees a message "This project isn't available. It may have been deleted or your permissions may have changed."

 !Screen Shot 2019-03-19 at 8.34.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

A pre-loader spin is visible and it keeps spinning forever

 !Screen Shot 2019-03-19 at 8.29.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

None for now
fields.summary: When a user accesses a next-gen or classic project which he/she does not have permission, the "This project isn't available" page never loads
After creating a branch in a jira ticket the browser is not redirected to the original ticket

fields.description: A feature to quickly edit page title instead of having to put the entire page in edit mode before being able to edit the page. Having the page title that appears in the page tree on the left navigation bar would definitely save time and improved user experience.
fields.summary: Quick edit multiple page titles in a faster way

fields.description:
When a user is using Jira on mobile, if they changed the group by, it affects the main board and changes the view for all users. 

Proposed solution:

# Either the group by feature should not be as obvious as the quick filter. The quick filters work by user preference.
# The feature should be better hidden like under settings.
fields.summary: Changing board group by in mobile view shouldn't affect the board on a global level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the new release of [Pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/pages-960705201.html], we found that it only allow to connect with Confluence on the same instance/site.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow connecting with Confluence on a separate instance (via Application Link)

h3. Why this is important
* Users may have hosted Jira and Confluence on a different site
* Users may have Confluence on multiple sites and would like to work on 1 project
fields.summary: Allow to connect Pages with Confluence on a separate instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Release Burndown report return completed issues on the incorrect Sprint if the issues were finished during a Sprint they are not added too.
The same applies to Epic Burndown report

Also, The Release Burndown will show the issue under the latest started sprint by the time the issue was completed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a release (*ABC*) and two Sprints (*123 and 789*)
 # Create a new issue *TEST-123* and add it to the Sprint *123* in the release ABC
 # Start the Sprint *123*
 # Finish the Sprint *123* and move the open issue to the *Backlog* or don't *fill resolution field*
 # Start the sprint *789* with different issues (Don't add the Issue *TEST-123*)
 # Close the issue *TEST-123 (Adding its resolution)*
 # Complete the Sprint *789*
 # Navigate to the *Release BurnDown Report* and select the release *ABC*

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a note mentioning the issue was not part of the sprint.
Or the correct sprint should be listed and a note informing the issue was completed after the sprint.
fields.summary: On burndown reports, display issues on correct sprint even if they were completed once the sprint was closed

fields.description:
h3. Scenario

As a user, there are often notes I need to see on the parent story when working in a sub-task assigned to me but I can't open the parent Story directly from the board.

h3. Actual Results

If the user is not the assignee of the Story it won't be possible to open the Story directly from the board when using filters (swimlanes or quick filters).

h3. Expected Results

To be able to open a Story when using quick filters directly from the board even though the user is not the assignee of that Story when using filters (swimlanes or quick filters).
fields.summary: When searching for a subtask assignee name, Jira board filter results don't allow to open the parent task for quick view, only the subtask

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to create and maintain a list of users I frequently mention in comments and story descriptions, so that I can quickly tag them in future comments.

 

I like to keep members of my team informed when I leave comments on stories.  I also appreciate their input to my or others' comments.  The comment structure is often:

@User1 (PM)

{ ... }

cc @User2 (BA) @User3 (Sr. Dev) @User4 (Dev) @User5 (Tester)

 

Cc'ing users into each comment quickly becomes a hassle, and often people in my organisation have similar names meaning there is a lot of room for user error.

 

Having a list of people I frequently mention, such as favourite contacts, would enable me to quickly ask and answer comments and keep all relevant parties informed.

 

Thank you,

Euan
fields.summary: List of frequently mentioned users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen boards are showing the errors below:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-13 at 17.56.39.png|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2019-03-13 at 18.28.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Next-gen board

h3. Expected Results
No error is listed.

h3. Actual Results
Boards are loading but with errors. 

h3. Notes
This is not impacting all sites.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Board failed to load

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I want to be able to export my reports (Burnup, Velocity) in order to share the information with the customers.

h3. Suggestion

Add an export/print button where only the information regarding the report is printed, instead of including Jira's side-bar.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to export my reports

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

DVCS "Configure automatic access" feature is not automatically giving newly-added JIRA users access to Bitbucket repositories

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud integrated with Bitbucket Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate a Bitbucket account with Jira
# Configure automatic team invitations as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-automatic-team-invitations-329982195.html]
# Add a new user to the Jira
# Authenticate in Jira using this new user account

h3. Expected Results

The newly-added user should receive an email invitation to join Bitbucket and the account group.

h3. Actual Results

The user does not receive an email invitation to join Bitbucket and the account group and the user is not added to Bitbucket.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

No workarounds available at the moment
fields.summary: DVCS "Configure automatic access" feature is not automatically giving newly-added JIRA users access to Bitbucket repositories

fields.description:
We use the next-gen project. We use Kanban. As you know, a developer who is free should take the next issue from the “ready for development” column.

The problem is that some of the issues in that column cannot be taken into development, since to perform them you first need to perform a blocking issue. This violates the whole Kanban principle.

As a solution, I have to “hide” the blocked issues to the backlog and monitor the progress of the blocking issues by myself. And after the blocking issues are done, I have to move the corresponding blocked tasks to the board, so that developers can take them to development.

You can create such a feature as optional. I think it'll be really useful.
fields.summary: As a user I want to automatically move blocked issue from backlog to board when blocking issue is done on next-gen boards

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*
The right-most column in the Jira Active Sprint Board is used to depict what issues/tasks are complete.

*Issue:*
Anything outside of this column is considered incomplete when a user tries to close a sprint and those tickets are forced out of the sprint.

*Repercussions:*
This means that if the board is configured to have 'Done' tickets in a different column, they are then added into another sprint or to the backlog when a user tries to close the current sprint, despite actually being completed. To get them back into the correct sprint, someone would then have to identify the tickets and bulk update them. (Note - it actually currently appends a new sprint onto them, so they end up with Closed Sprint and Next Sprint... e.g. 'Sprint 1, Sprint 2' (, Sprint 3, Sprint 4, etc).

Forcing all Jira admins to configure their workboards so that the right-most column holds all completed task statuses seems to go against principles of flexibility and autonomy, as it doesn't allow teams to set up their workflows to suit them best.

*Example:*
We have a Task board, with statuses in this order:
TO DO - WAITING - IN PROGRESS - DONE - CANCELLED
Cancelled is to the right, so that it's out of the way but still visible.
Even if we put the Done column to the right, the cancelled items would be forced to move to the next sprint when we try to close this sprint.
We don't want to add both statuses to the same column.

*Suggested solution:*
Associate a Status Type (Complete vs Incomplete) with each Status, rather than using a single column to determine this. 
Allow admins to specify/configure this value against each status.
fields.summary: Closing Sprints and use of the 'Done column'

fields.description:
Dear Team,

I had problems with the JQL syntax comment!~ on Kanban Board's Quick Filter. I later found out that the syntax only works when there is only one comment in Jira ticket. However, when I tried comment~, it works just fine, even when there are more than one comment in the ticket.

Since working with JIRA, , I rarely ever see any tickets with only one comment.

So, I think that adjustment to the syntax would make it much more useful.

Could you please consider to make the improvement?

Thank You and Best Regards,

Puntip A.

 

Refer to: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-458779
fields.summary: Adjust jql syntax "comment!~" to work when there are more than one comment in ticket

fields.description:
h3. Description

When deleting a Sprint it displays the same message when it is active or not.

h3. Scenario

The message, right now, is displayed as following, either for Active or Future Sprints:
!Screen Shot 2019-03-12 at 15.11.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

When deleting an active Sprint have:

* Or an additional confirmation;
* A different message warning that the Sprint that is about to be deleted is an Active Sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to have a different confirmation screen when deleting an Active Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there when viewing the burnup report in a next-gen project, there is no way to eliminate non-working days, such as weekends or holidays.  This is something you can do in classic projects by configuring the board -> Working days and selecting which days of the week your team typically works.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to configure working days in a next-gen project

h3. Why this is important
The burnup report is less helpful for any sprint/project that runs multiple weeks in the current setup.  Having 2/7 days a week where teams are commonly not working is skewing the effectiveness of this report in regards to how team leads/management estimate time it takes to complete tasks.
Also this is functionality that exists in Classic projects
fields.summary: Configure working days in team-managed projects

fields.description: As a user, it would be good having an Epic Report gadget so I can follow up my work without accessing the project, navigating through the menu options to access the report.
fields.summary: Create Epic Report gadget
